reviews.text: A can't miss sight, that I somehow managed to miss the first two times I visited Berlin, Tempelhof is something you won't find anywhere else. Formerly the East Berlin airport, rather than renovate or tear it down, it's been largely converted to public and park space. It hosted the marathon expo, and is the perfect space for events. The main arrival hall is still there as are baggage claims, passport control, and of course the runways. The hangars host massive event space and the grounds are perfect for exploring green spaces and maybe even taking a picnic.

Amazing historical venue, impressive building. The park itself is a really beautiful place to come and relax, walk or run. Dog friendly, also! If you want to visit the Hangar, beware you can do so only in organized tours (German or English) which would be better to buy or research online in advance.

We did a tour through the airport. The guide (Celine?) was great. The building is so impressive. We saw some special places in the building, like bunkers and a basketbal court. I would really recommend this place to anyone who visits Berlin!

We visited Berlin Tempelhof airport for the history/architecture tour and it really is worth it. It has witnessed so much in the past, good and bad and the tour was a great way to discover this.
Other than that the area is a recreational space and attracts locals for walks, cycling, and more. Quite impressive that Berlin managed to keep such a large open space available for public use.

We took the airport walking tours. It costs around 15 euros and is worth every penny! The guide took us through the terminal building and onto the tarmac. The terminal building contains hidden spaces which you would not expect in present day airports. I didn’t want the tour to end. In my opinion this was the hidden gem of Berlin.

This place was awesome!! So much information and all of it interesting. Our group spent three hours there and that was definitely not enough time. There were so many hangers with a wide range of planes and artifacts we could have easily spent five hours there without seeing everything! A few of the planes were actually open to walk through so that was really cool seeing the inside. I walked through Air Force One and a space shuttle! Overall really cool experience completely free of charge.

Excellent museum. The layout is fantastic with a good flow allowing for a large amount of aircraft and displays without appearing cluttered. Many of the displays had retired Air Force pilots and aircrew next to them who had flown those aircraft and talking to them was a real treat. Depending on how much you want to see and read, you could easily spend days here. The WWII section and presidential aircraft stand out as highlights of a truly fantastic selection. Make the time to stop by. You need at least an hour here, but 2-3 hours would allow you to see most of the displays. Admission is free and it is very family friendly. Don’t bring water, food, knives, guns, etc because you will be turned away. Enjoy!

A must see for anyone! If you only have a limited amount of time, take the guided tour of the first hanger. It takes about 1.5 hours but the guides are excellent and super knowledgeable. 
It’s a great place for kids too. My girls (1 and 3) love visiting and seeing all the planes. Unless you can dedicate an entire day, plan on visiting several times so you can see it all.

What a wonderful experience the National Air force Museum brings. A great place for families to spend time together.  Also very affordable considering it is free to enter. They have a store where you can purchase souvenirs and they also take your photo when you first come in that with a small fee you can pick up at the end of journey. There are simulator rides for the whole family to enjoy. I would plan a whole day to really enjoy and embrace the history of the Museum.

An extensive and amazing collection of aircraft, rockets and exotic vehicles. It's worth a while day of exploring. A lot of history and inspiration. Great for children. Get there early to try out some of the simulators. Staff is very helpful and getting around is easy. Expect to walk a lot!

Pretty solid museum. A lot of history about St. Mary's and Patuxent River. You can go in the back and look at the old trainers/prototypes as well. They are slowly getting more stuff in, but it's a nice little place to go to once.

This was a special trip for my kiddos for school. They enjoyed seeing all the old airplanes and learnig about the how they where used in the Navy. The staff was friendly and very knowledgeable about things. Definitely recommend this anyone who home schools or just loves planes.
Very welcoming, friendly, and knowledgable staff. The volunteer staff are fantastic. Awesome displays! The large model aircraft carrier is very impressive.
Very informative Volunteers.  Find one and ask questions.  It was worth every penny?  Cool to sit in an F-14 cockpit for a 30 minute simulator session.
Love the new additions. Love how they have organized everything.  Love the history.

What an incredible piece of history this is. The location is easy, no problem with the parking lot. The ship is rock, this what made the history. There are so much to learn, a perfect way to spend your day. By the way, lots of steep stairwells to go up and down so keep that in mind for walking shoes/dressing comfortably. I love the place what awesome experiences.

Awesome place to learn about our Navy history. This ship museum has a lot to offer for site seeing. Our children enjoyed it a lot. They have everything displayed very well and even have the descriptions readable.

The food area is a little expensive but that is expected.

The bathrooms are on the second deck of the ship and you have to climb down a tight stair way. 

If you're six foot and taller watch your head. The ship has some low places that you bump your head pretty good if you're not paying attention. 

If you have a baby in a stroller there some area you cannot take the stroller through. So make sure you have your baby back pack carrier ready available. Upon arriving you can choose to walk or wait for the cart service to pick you up.

The souvenir shop is really nice and has a lot of goodies for everyone.

Enjoy your time while visiting here!

The entrance fee was not bad and it takes an easy 3 to 4 hours to do the tours without spending a lot of time reading at the exhibits. They also have lots of movies etc. It is a great way to pay respects to all members of the military especially the Navy and our WWII vets. Go and see this you will not be disappointed.

So where do I begin? Well the experience was fantastic. The employees and the tour guides were knowledgeable about the location of certain things and also about the ship. The tours were an A+, 10/10 stars. Really loved the new renovated Lexington. Food was so good as well. We didn't have a single problem, period. I really enjoyed the escape room and the objectives it presented. Real nice touch of excitement to the entire experience.

Great experience! Enjoyed the escape room. Loved all the airplanes and history. The 3D movie was entertaining. The food was good, really enjoyed the onion rings. The food in the galley looked real. A full day of fun and learning.
